source_sentence: 各各相隨，任取所食。
translation: Each follows the other, and they're free to take what they eat.

source_sentence: 時彼獸中有一牸虎，端正少雙，於諸獸中無比類者。
translation: Among those animals, there was a gray tiger with few pairs of legs, which was so handsome and incomparable among the animals.

translation: Don't fight with each other, and listen to the tiger that chooses who he wants to be his match, for that animal is our king.'

source_sentence: 「『世人皆取我之糞，　　持用塗地為清淨，
translation: 'All the people in the world take my dung and rub it on the ground to make it pure.

source_sentence: 是故端正賢牸虎，　　應當取我以為夫。』
translation: That's why the handsome tiger of goodness and virtue should take me as their husband.'

source_sentence: 「『汝項斛領甚高大，　　止堪駕車及挽犁，
translation: 'Your neck is so high and large that it's capable of pulling a cart or dragging a plow.

source_sentence: 云何將是醜身形，　　怱欲為我作夫主。』
translation: How could it be an ugly body shape that desires to be a husband for me?'

source_sentence: 時，諸獸中有一牛王，向於牸虎而說偈言：「是時，牸虎向彼牛王說偈答言：「是時，

source_sentence: 「『我是雪山大象王，　　戰鬪用我無不勝，
translation: 'I am the great elephant king of the Himalayas, and there is no one who can defeat me in battle.

source_sentence: 我既有是大威力，　　汝今何不作我妻？』
translation: Since I have such great authority, why don't you now become my wife?'

source_sentence: 「『汝若見聞師子王，　　膽懾驚怖馳奔走，
translation: 'If you see and hear that the lion king Is overwhelmed by fear, fleeing in terror.

source_sentence: 遺失屎尿狼藉去，　　云何堪得為我夫？』
translation: How could you be my husband if you were to leave the leftovers of your excrement and urine in a wasteful place?'

source_sentence: 復有一大白象向於牸虎而說偈言：「是時，牸虎復以偈答彼白象言：「爾時，
translation: Again, there was a large white elephant facing the tiger and said in verse to him, “Then the tiger answered the white elephant in verse:

source_sentence: 「『汝今觀我此形容，　　前分闊大後纖細，
translation: “‘Now you see my appearance, which is broad and large in front and slender in back.

source_sentence: 在於山中自恣活，　　復能存恤餘眾生。
translation: In the mountains they make their living freely, And are also able to provide for other sentient beings.

source_sentence: 我是一切諸獸王，　　無有更能勝我者，
translation: I am the king of all animals; There is no one else who can overpower me.

source_sentence: 若有見我及聞聲，　　諸獸悉皆奔不住。
translation: If there's anyone who sees me or hears my voice, the animals all run and don't abide.

source_sentence: 我今如是力猛壯，　　威神甚大不可論，
translation: I am now thus powerful and mighty, With unspeakably great power.

source_sentence: 是故賢虎汝當知，　　乃可為我作於婦。』
translation: That's why you should know, good tiger, that you can become my wife.'

source_sentence: 「『大力勇猛及威神，　　身體形容極端正，
translation: 'With great strength, courage, and mighty power, his body is perfectly proportioned.

source_sentence: 如是我今得夫已，　　必當頂戴而奉承。』」
translation: Thus, now that I've obtained my husband, I will surely carry him on my head and venerate him.'

source_sentence: 彼中有一師子諸獸之王，向彼牸虎而說偈言：「時，彼牸虎向師子王而說偈言：爾時，
translation: There was a lion among them, the king of animals, who addressed the tiger and said in verse to him, “Then that tiger addressed the king of animals, saying:

source_sentence: 佛告優陀夷言：「汝優陀夷！
translation: The Buddha told Udayana, You, Udayana!

source_sentence: 應當悟解，彼時師子諸獸王者，即我身是；
translation: You should be enlightened and understand that the lion king of animals at that time was none other than I myself.

source_sentence: 時彼牸虎，今瞿多彌釋女是也；
translation: The female tiger of that time was the present-day Śākyamuni’s daughter Gotama.

source_sentence: 時彼諸獸，現今五百釋童子是。
translation: Those animals then were the present-day five hundred children of the Śākyas.

source_sentence: 當於彼時，其瞿多彌已嫌諸獸，意不願樂，聞我說偈，即作我妻。
translation: At the time, that Gautamī disliked the animals and didn't want to be happy, so he heard me say a verse and became my wife.

source_sentence: 今日亦然，捨諸釋種五百童子，既嫌薄已，取我為夫。
translation: Today, it's likewise, forsaking the five hundred boys of the Śākya clan, who disliked me as their husband.

source_sentence: 「時，淨飯王為其太子立三等宮，以擬安置於太子故，第一宮內，所有婇女，
translation: “At that time, King Śuddhodana had three palaces built for the prince’s sake:

source_sentence: 當於初夜，侍衛太子。
translation: On the first watch of the night, he was guarding the prince.

source_sentence: 第二宮內，其諸婇女，於夜半時，供承太子。
translation: In the second palace, these court ladies made offerings to the prince at midnight.

source_sentence: 第三宮內，諸婇女輩，於後夜時，侍奉太子。
translation: In the third palace, there were court ladies who served the prince late at night.

source_sentence: 其第一宮，耶輸陀羅最為上首，二萬婇女，圍繞侍立。
translation: In the first palace, Yaśodharā was the highest of the chiefs, surrounded by twenty thousand court ladies.

source_sentence: 「第二宮中，摩奴陀羅(隋言意持)而為上首。
translation: In the second palace, Mañjuśrī (known as manas in Sui) is the supreme leader.

source_sentence: 「（諸師復言：『此意持妃，唯聞其名，不見現在及往緣事。』
translation: (The masters also said, 'This is the only thing that I want to do for my queen, and when I hear her name, I don't see any present or past events.'

source_sentence: ）「第三宮內，即瞿多彌而為上首。

translation: In this order, there were sixty thousand court ladies who attended the prince and his court ladies.

translation: Again, another teacher said: The maidservants of the crown prince and the court ladies together numbered one hundred thousand.

source_sentence: 二萬悉是釋剎利種，所餘八萬並是眾雜異姓諸女。』
translation: Twenty thousand of them were all Śākyas, and the remaining 80,000 were women of mixed different castes.'

source_sentence: ）「時，淨飯王念阿私陀仙人所說，故於宮內復更別造一大好殿，猶如秋雲靉靆光潤，
translation: ) Then King Śuddhodana, mindful of what the holy man Asita had said, built another large and beautiful pavilion inside the palace, just like an autumn cloud shining brightly and moistened it.

source_sentence: 作事微妙實難思議，順一切時而受快樂，鈎蘭閣道一切正等，無有偏頗。
translation: Their deeds are subtle, real, and inconceivable, and they experience happiness at all times accordingly, with no partiality or distinction to the path of the Mahāraṇakaṇḍa.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 恐畏太子處處遊行，見諸濁穢。
translation: I'm afraid that the prince will wander everywhere and see all the filthy things.

source_sentence: 復教宮內，色別置立諸雜音聲，各各千數，其中所謂一千箜篌，一千具箏，
translation: He also instructed them to set up a thousand different sounds in the palace, each one of which was called a thousand lutes and a thousand stringed instruments.

source_sentence: 一千五絃，一千小鼓，一千具筑，一千張琴，一千琵琶，一千細鼓，一千大鼓，
translation: There were one thousand five stringed instruments, one thousand small drums, one thousand sets of instruments, one thousand lutes, one thousand lutes, one thousand lutes, one thousand subtle drums, and one thousand grand drums.

source_sentence: 一千具笛，一千具笙，一千銅鈸，一千具簫，一千篳篥，一千具箎，一千具螺，
translation: There were a thousand flutes, a thousand cheers, a thousand brass instruments, a thousand pipes, a thousand lutes, a thousand rhythms, a thousand syllables, and a thousand conches.

source_sentence: 諸如是等，一切音聲，種別一千，一千種歌，一千種舞，其手及聲，常於宮內晝夜不絕，
translation: All these kinds of sounds were differentiated into one thousand, one thousand kinds of singing and one thousand kinds of dancing. Their hands and voices always sounded in the palace day and night without cease.

source_sentence: 猶大雲內，出於隱隱甚深之聲。
translation: It's like a great cloud within a great cloud that produces a profound sound of seclusion.

source_sentence: 如是太子在於最妙最勝婇女百千之中，前後圍繞，受諸快樂，恭敬侍養，
translation: The prince was thus surrounded by hundreds of thousands of the finest and most beautiful court ladies, experiencing various pleasures, being attended with respect and reverence.

source_sentence: 一切皆以種種瓔珞，莊嚴其身。
translation: They all adorned their bodies with various jewelry.

translation: They also stringed the seven treasures of gold and silver rings around their arms and made sounds like Indra, accepting all the jadelike maidens to dance and sing.

source_sentence: 最勝最妙，語言姿媚，相囑相笑，相抱相嗚，相觀相眄。
translation: Their speech is sweet and pleasing, their words are entrusted to each other and they laugh together. They embrace each other and howl, and they look at each other with amazement.

translation: He's able to cause the prince to rejoice and enjoy pleasure, so he doesn't have to wade far from the palace or travel outside the palace, just like Indra, the goddess of heavenly jade, to amuse herself.

source_sentence: 如是如是，太子在於女寶之中，受諸歡樂，乃至其中諸婇女等，巧解五慾，
translation: Thus and so forth, the prince was among the women treasures, experiencing various pleasures, even to the point where all the court ladies there skillfully liberated themselves from the five desires.

translation: He was always strong and weak, making the princes rejoice; he would not allow them to go outside the palace.

source_sentence: 「時，淨飯王為增太子諸功德故，建立苦行，斷於一切諸邪惡法，行一切善，

source_sentence: 布施諸物，造眾福業，備行苦行，以此善根迴資太子，為令增長諸功德故，
translation: They give gifts of all kinds of things, perform meritorious deeds, prepare and practice austerities, and provide the prince with these roots of goodness so that they will increase in virtue.

source_sentence: 願莫出家。
translation: Please don't leave home.

source_sentence: 「『大王增長太子故，　　復以私陀授記因，
translation: 'It's because the great king grows to become a prince, and it's also because he gives assurance of future enlightenment by means of his samādhi.

translation: He cultivates austerities and abandons what's not good, always sitting with his wise ministers in contemplation.'

source_sentence: 是故偈言：「如是次第，太子在於父王宮內，唯獨一人具足五慾，娛樂逍遙，

translation: He played and enjoyed his pastimes freely, never going out for more than ten years.

translation: Going out and coming in, they'll observe both inside and outside their objects so that there won't be another person who surpasses me; if he surpasses me, I'm afraid that person will come and snatch my kingship.'

source_sentence: 時諸臣等即差兩人，令巡境界。
translation: The ministers and others then sent two men to travel around the perimeter.

translation: There's the highest and most precipitous snowy mountain, and there's a distinct family at the foot of that mountain called Śākyamuni.

source_sentence: 族內初新產一童子，其人端正，善得生地，兼彼姓氏，第一特尊，眷屬豪強，

translation: They are endowed with the thirty-two marks of a great man and also possess eighty-eight kinds of embellishments.

source_sentence: 彼生之日，有諸解相婆羅門等，以授其記：「今此童子，身體具有三十二相八十種好，
translation: On the day he was born, some brahmans with liberating features gave him a prediction, saying, “This boy’s body has thirty-two distinctive marks and eighty secondary signs.

source_sentence: 炳著分明。
translation: It's clearly visible and distinct.

source_sentence: 其若在家，必定得作轉輪聖王，統四天下，十善化民，七寶充備，不用兵仗，
translation: If he stays at home, he'll surely become a wheel-turning sage king who governs the four continents, commands the ten good qualities to transform people, is fully equipped with the seven treasures, and doesn't use weapons

source_sentence: 自然歸降；
translation: They will naturally return and descend.

translation: “The messenger then returned on foot and said to the king Bimbisara about this matter up to religious practice, as explained above.

source_sentence: 『是故大王！

source_sentence: 及其幼年，速當起兵滅彼童子，莫令於後來奪我等大王之位。』
translation: As a young child, you must quickly arouse an army to exterminate that boy and not allow him to take the throne of our great kingship in the future.'

source_sentence: 作是語已，摩伽陀王頻婆娑羅，即告於彼二使人言：『卿等二人莫作是說！
translation: After he said this, the king of Magadha Bimbisāra told those two messengers, 'You two, don't say that!'

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 若如汝言，脫彼童子必定得作轉輪聖王，如法治化，我當敬奉伏接隨從，
translation: If you do as you say, that boy will surely be liberated and become a wheel-turning sage king, teaching according to the Dharma. I will respectfully subdue him and receive and follow him.

source_sentence: 依彼威神，我等受樂，安隱治化；
translation: By relying on their mighty power, we will be able to receive the happiness of peace and ease in our training.

source_sentence: 若彼捨家得作佛者，慈悲憐愍，度脫眾生，我等為其作於聲聞受法弟子。
translation: If someone renounces home and becomes a buddha, they'll be compassionate and compassionate, liberating sentient beings, and we'll become śrāvakas and Dharma disciples for them.

source_sentence: 今觀如是二種果報福德因緣，不可興心加害於彼。』
translation: Now, I'll observe these two kinds of causes and conditions of merit as retribution, so I can't harm them with an arousal of mind.'

source_sentence: 「時，淨飯王於其太子所住宮院，周匝別更造立子城，唯置一門名為野獸，
translation: “At that time King Śuddhodana built a separate city for the prince’s palace where the prince lived, surrounded by wild beasts.

source_sentence: 彼門下關安施機發，開閉之時，有五百人扶持擁衛，方得開闔，其門聲動聞半由旬。
translation: When the door was opened and shut, there were five hundred people to support and embrace it, and only then could they open and close it, which was half a yojana in size for the śrāvakas at the gate.

source_sentence: 次第二重中院宮閤，亦開一門，其關鍵鑰，皆安機發，開閉之時有三百人，
translation: Next, the second story of the inner sanctum of the middle court also had one gate that opened and closed. The keys to these keys were all set up in an orderly fashion; there were three hundred attendants at the time of opening and closing.

source_sentence: 其聲聞徹一拘盧奢。
translation: That śrāvaka penetrates one krośa.

source_sentence: 次至內宮太子坐殿，復有一門，鍵鑰累關亦安機發，開閉擎接有二百人，
translation: Next, on arriving at the inner sanctum, the prince sat in the palace. There was another entrance that opened and closed with two hundred attendants holding the keys to the doors of the locks so as to open and close the doors.

source_sentence: 禦備轉嚴，非人間比，其聲聞及半拘盧奢。
translation: Their defences became more and more imposing, incomparable to those of the people. The śrāvakas and one-half a koṭi of krośas were present.

translation: The three gates were guarded by strong men of the inner and outer silos, armored and strong, with their hands holding various weapons for battle.

translation: Thus, the sheriff feared that the prince would abandon the bell-shaped room and leave home, fleeing to the mountainous forest.

source_sentence: 佛本行集經空聲勸厭品第十五
translation: Chapter 15 of the Sutra on the Collection of the Past Activities of the Buddha, Encouragement by the Sound of Emptiness

source_sentence: 「爾時，虛空有一天子，名曰作瓶，彼天見是太子，十年在於宮內受五慾樂，
translation: “At the time, there was a celestial being in space named Vase Maker. Seeing him, the prince spent ten years in his palace enjoying the pleasures of the five desires:

source_sentence: 作是思惟：『此之護明菩薩大士，縱極多時在彼宮內受諸五慾，莫為貪著是五慾故，
translation: They think, ‘These are the five kinds of desire that should be avoided by these bodhisattva mahāsattvas:

source_sentence: 心醉荒迷情放盈溢。
translation: Their minds are drunk, deluded, and overflowing with emotions.

source_sentence: 百年迅速，時不待人，護明菩薩今須覺察，早應捐棄捨俗出家。
translation: With a hundred years of swiftness, he doesn't need to wait for people at the right time, and now the Dharmapāla Bodhisattva must realize that he should abandon the secular world and leave home sooner.

source_sentence: 我若不先為彼作於厭離之相，則彼耽湎，未有醒寤發出家心。
translation: If I don't first create the characteristic of disillusionment for them, they'll become addicted, and they won't awaken and give up their hometown thoughts.

source_sentence: 我今應當讚助其事，為成就故。』
translation: Now, I should praise them for their accomplishment.'

source_sentence: 「『身自被縛欲解他，　　譬若盲人引群瞽，
translation: 'It's like a blind man leading a crowd of people who are bound by their own bodies and wanting to liberate others.

source_sentence: 己身解脫乃免彼，　　猶如有目能導人。
translation: Being liberated himself, he's able to avoid them, just like a man with eyesight who can guide people.

source_sentence: 善哉仁今年盛時，　　宜速出家令願滿，
translation: Good, my dear friend! At the height of this year’s prosperity, it is advisable for you to quickly renounce household life and fulfill your vow.

source_sentence: 應當利益天人等。　　五欲行者不可厭，
translation: They should benefit gods, humans, and so on.

source_sentence: 沒溺六塵境捨難，　　唯有出世行大智，
translation: Not submerged in the objects of the six dust motes, it’s difficult to relinquish. There is only supramundane practice and great knowledge:

source_sentence: 乃能厭離此五慾，　　是故仁今可捐棄。
translation: They are able to become disillusioned with these five desires, so now you can abandon them.

source_sentence: 眾生多有煩惱患，　　仁當為作大醫師，
translation: Sentient beings often suffer from afflictions, So kindly become great physicians for them.

source_sentence: 說妙種種法藥王，　　速疾將向涅槃岸。
translation: Explaining the various wonderful medicines of the Dharma king, he'll quickly go to the shore of nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 無明黑暗所障蔽，　　諸見羅網種種纏，
translation: They are hindered by the darkness of ignorance, With various webs of views and various fetters.

source_sentence: 速然智慧大燈明，　　早使天人得淨眼。』
translation: hastily, the great lamp of wisdom shines brightly, and soon gods and humans will attain the pure eye.'

source_sentence: 作瓶天子，即於夜半，而說偈言：「爾時，空中作瓶天子說此偈已，威神感動發勸因緣，
translation: At midnight, the jug-opening celestial spoke these verses in verse: At that moment, the jug-opening celestial in the sky uttered these verses.

source_sentence: 復以太子宿世善根福德力故，令彼宮內婇女伎兒所作音聲歌曲，不順五慾之事，
translation: Again, by the power of the virtue of his roots of goodness from previous lives, the prince caused the court ladies and children in that palace to make sounds and songs not compliant with the desires of the five senses.

source_sentence: 「『世間事無常，　　猶如雲出電，
translation: 'All worldly affairs are impermanent, like clouds producing lightning.

source_sentence: 尊者今時至，　　應捨家出家。
translation: Venerable, when the time comes, you should leave home and leave home.

source_sentence: 一切行無常，　　如瓦坏瓶器，
translation: All conditioned things are impermanent, Like a broken tile that breaks up a pot.

source_sentence: 如借他物用，　　如積乾土城，
translation: It's like borrowing someone else's property for use, like accumulating dry dirt in a city.

source_sentence: 不久便破壞，　　猶如夏泥壁，
translation: Soon it will be destroyed, just like a wall of mud in summer.

source_sentence: 如河兩岸沙，　　緣生不能久。
translation: It's like the two sides of a river that are sandy, and conditioned arising can't last long.

source_sentence: 猶如燈出炎，　　生已速還滅，
translation: It's like a lamp that produces heat, which quickly returns and ceases after being produced.

source_sentence: 如風無暫住，　　急疾不曾停。
translation: It's like a wind that doesn't stand still for a moment, and it doesn't stop even once in an hurry.

source_sentence: 恒常無真實，　　猶如芭蕉心，
translation: They are eternal and unreal, just like the heart of a plantain.

source_sentence: 幻化誑人意，　　空拳誘小兒。
translation: He's illusory and deceiving the minds of people, With an empty fist he tempts small children.

source_sentence: 一切諸行者，　　皆悉因緣生，
translation: All conditioned things Are all produced by causes and conditions.

source_sentence: 各各有緣因，　　愚癡輩不覺。
translation: Each has its own causal cause, but foolish people don't realize it.

source_sentence: 猶如人索繩，　　手木成因緣，
translation: It's like when a person asks for a rope, and the hand makes a cause and condition of wood.

source_sentence: 如因子生芽，　　離子芽不生。
translation: Just as the seed of a cause produces sprouts, But the seed that is not produced does not produce sprouts.

source_sentence: 二相離不成，　　復非常無常，
translation: The two characteristics are free from one another and not formed. Furthermore, they are neither eternal nor impermanent.

source_sentence: 諸行因癡生，　　彼不住無明。
translation: Conditions arise because of delusion, and they don't abide in ignorance.

source_sentence: 無明亦非彼，　　本性來空寂，
translation: Neither is ignorance. Their original nature comes from emptiness and quiescence.

source_sentence: 生滅無體故，　　如印成印文。
translation: Because arising and ceasing have no essence, it's like the text of the seal that forms the seal.

source_sentence: 非彼非離彼，　　諸行亦如是，
translation: The same applies to formations that are neither the same nor different.

source_sentence: 眼不離於色，　　識眼色因生。
translation: The eye is not separate from matter: Consciousness of the eye and matter arise by reason of the eye.

source_sentence: 此三不相離，　　三亦不真實，
translation: These three are not separate, and the three are also not real.

source_sentence: 空淨不淨法，　　眼等分別生，
translation: The pure and impure dharmas of emptiness, such as the eye, etc., are produced by discrimination.

source_sentence: 此顛倒分別，　　皆悉由識生。
translation: These mistaken discriminations all arise from consciousness.

source_sentence: 若有巧智人，　　推求識所生，
translation: If there is a skillful wise person Who investigates the arising of consciousness,

source_sentence: 知彼無去來，　　知我如幻化，
translation: Knowing they have no going or coming, They know the self is like magic.

source_sentence: 如兩木出火，　　第三因於手，
translation: It is like fire coming out of two pieces of wood: the third, from the hand.

source_sentence: 若無此三因，　　則不得火用。
translation: If these three causes did not exist, Then the function of fire would not be possible.

source_sentence: 若智推求者，　　彼亦無去來，
translation: If someone with knowledge investigates, They also have no going or coming.

source_sentence: 諸方尋求已，　　不見火來去。
translation: Having searched in all directions, they don't see the fire coming or going.

source_sentence: 陰入諸界等，　　因貪癡業生，
translation: Such [things] as aggregates, sense-fields, elements, etc., arise due to the action of greed and delusion.

source_sentence: 和合因眾生，　　真如無眾生。
translation: The combined causes are sentient beings, but the true nature has no sentient beings.

source_sentence: 咽喉脣口舌，　　而出諸文字，
translation: His throat, throat, lips, mouth, and tongue Produce words.

source_sentence: 字非是咽喉，　　亦非離彼等，
translation: The lettering is not the throat, Nor apart from it.

source_sentence: 彼等和合故，　　出語隨於智。
translation: Because of their conjunction, they speak according to knowledge.

source_sentence: 語言不在智，　　亦復無色形，
translation: Words are not in knowledge, And form is also formless.

source_sentence: 生處及滅處，　　智人求不得。
translation: The sphere of arising and the sphere of cessation cannot be sought by wise people.

source_sentence: 所觀悉空寂，　　語言如響聲，
translation: All that they contemplate is void and silent, And their words are like echoes.

source_sentence: 因木因諸絃，　　人智三合故，
translation: Because of the causes of wood and the causes of strings, because of the three combinations of humans and wisdom.

source_sentence: 箜篌而出聲，　　彼聲三處無。
translation: The sound that arises from the harp is not present in any of the three places.

source_sentence: 若有智慧人，　　求彼聲來去，
translation: If there are wise people who seek that sound, they come and go.

source_sentence: 諸方求覓已，　　去來不可得，
translation: Seeking in all directions, they can't get it, and neither going nor coming is possible.

source_sentence: 因及有緣者，　　諸行如是生。
translation: Conditioned things arise in the same way as causes and conditioned things:

source_sentence: 有諦了之人，　　空觀應如是，
translation: Those who understand the truths should contemplate emptiness like this.

source_sentence: 陰入及諸界，　　內外悉皆寂。
translation: The aggregates, sense-fields, and all realms— All are quiescent, inside and out.

source_sentence: 求一切處我，　　如虛空無形，
translation: Seeking the self of all places is like space without form,

source_sentence: 如是諸法相，　　仁於定光佛，
translation: Thus are the characteristics of all dharmas kindly shown to the Buddha Dīpaṅkara,

source_sentence: 往昔已證知，　　今為天人說。
translation: I've realized it in the past, and now I'll explain it for gods and humans.

source_sentence: 顛倒分別故，　　欲等火焚燒，
translation: Because of mistaken discrimination, they are burned by such fires as desire.

source_sentence: 應起慈悲雲，　　施甘露法雨。
translation: You should produce a cloud of compassion and bestow the Dharma rain of ambrosia.

source_sentence: 仁昔於億劫，　　念施及持戒，
translation: For hundreds of millions of eons in the past, you were mindful of giving and observing precepts.

source_sentence: 我得無上道，　　聖財分諸世。
translation: I've attained the unsurpassed path, and my noble possessions are shared with all the worlds.

source_sentence: 尊者念往昔，　　聖財施貧窮，
translation: The venerable was mindful of the past, when his holy possessions were given to the poor.

source_sentence: 以將聖財攝，　　調御莫慳惜。
translation: To gather the holy treasures, don't be stingy or stingy with regulation.

source_sentence: 仁昔持淨戒，　　窮急不偷財，
translation: Good man, in the past you observed pure precepts, Because you did not steal property in times of distress.

source_sentence: 願開甘露門，　　為諸眾生說。
translation: May you open the gate of ambrosia and explain it for sentient beings.

source_sentence: 憶念往昔行，　　當閉地獄門，
translation: Remembering my past actions, I'll shut the doors of hell.

source_sentence: 善開解脫路，　　戒行心願成。
translation: He well opens the path of liberation, observes precepts and vows, and fulfills his vow.

source_sentence: 往昔修忍辱，　　聞他毀罵等，
translation: In the past, they cultivated forbearance and heard others disparage them.

source_sentence: 建立忍辱故，　　觀諸行悉空。
translation: Because of the establishment of forbearance, they observe that all conditioned things are completely empty.

source_sentence: 念此往行故，　　世間瞋恚多，
translation: Mindful of these past actions, there’s much hatred in the world.

source_sentence: 教住於忍辱，　　莫捨彼願力。
translation: Teach them to abide in forbearance, and don't abandon their power of vows.

source_sentence: 仁者行精進，　　當得我淨智，
translation: Gentlemen, if you make effort, You will attain my pure knowledge.

source_sentence: 在於煩惱海，　　度眾到彼岸。
translation: In the ocean of afflictions, he saves people and reaches the other shore.

source_sentence: 念於往昔願，　　拔眾四苦河，
translation: Mindful of my past vows, I’ll pull out the four rivers of suffering.

source_sentence: 出大精進力，　　度脫厄難等。
translation: It produces the power of great effort, which frees them from hardships and difficulties.

source_sentence: 往昔修習禪，　　為斷諸煩惱，
translation: Cultivating meditation in the past In order to eliminate all afflictions,

source_sentence: 諸根不調者，　　教令調伏故。
translation: Someone whose faculties aren't disciplined teaches and causes them to be disciplined.

source_sentence: 仁念於往昔，　　愍眾在煩惱，
translation: Mindful of the past, you pity those who are afflicted by affliction.

source_sentence: 寂靜諸慧等，　　調伏彼諸根。
translation: The wisdom of quiescence and so forth, which tames those faculties.

source_sentence: 仁昔修智慧，　　願破煩惱暗，
translation: You cultivated wisdom in the past, wishing to destroy the darkness of afflictions.

source_sentence: 愍眾在無明，　　開示真如眼。
translation: The vast multitude of sentient beings are in ignorance, revealing the true eye.

source_sentence: 仁念於往昔，　　眾生煩惱瞑，
translation: Remembering the past, sentient beings’ afflictions are stilled.

source_sentence: 開無濁穢明，　　仁最勝智慧，
translation: He opens the untainted, defiled light of benevolence and supreme wisdom.

source_sentence: 應愍諸眾生，　　方便教令出。
translation: You should pity sentient beings and skillfully teach them to leave.

source_sentence: 三界生老病火熾，　　飢渴熱炎不曾休，
translation: The three realms of birth, old age, and sickness are blazing with hunger, thirst, heat, and fever.

source_sentence: 應當為世作大橋，　　濟渡令歸到彼岸。
translation: You should build a great bridge for the world, cross over and return to the other shore.

source_sentence: 眾生流轉煩惱海，　　猶如蜂在竹孔間，
translation: Sentient beings revolve in the ocean of afflictions, Like bees in a hole in a bamboo tree.

source_sentence: 三有循復若秋雲，　　上下往還無止息。
translation: Three, there's a succession like an autumn cloud that goes up and down without stopping.

source_sentence: 亦如戲場諸幻化，　　又似山川逝水流，
translation: It's also like the illusions at playgrounds, or like mountains and rivers passing on water.

source_sentence: 眾生老病死亦然，　　或生天人三惡道。
translation: Old age, sickness, and death of sentient beings are likewise, or they may be born in the three bad destinies of gods and humans.

source_sentence: 諸有慾癡不自在，　　展轉五道無覺知，
translation: Those with craving and delusion aren’t self-willed; In the five realms of rebirth they develop without awareness.

source_sentence: 猶如陶師旋火輪，　　處處五欲自纏縛，
translation: It's like a potter spinning the fire wheel, Everywhere bound by the five desires themselves.

source_sentence: 猶如飛鳥犯羅網，　　亦如獵師布黐膠，
translation: It's like a flying bird violating a net, or like a hunter spreading silk and glue.

source_sentence: 貪他財寶無厭足，　　如魚吞餌遇釣鈎。
translation: They covet the riches of others and don't tire of them, like a fish swallowing its lure and encountering a fishing hook.

source_sentence: 諍競忿怒結怨讐，　　煩惱染著受諸苦，
translation: Anger, strife, anger, hatred, enemies, afflictions, attachments, and suffering.

source_sentence: 五慾過患如利刀，　　亦如妙器盛毒藥，
translation: The five cravings and faults are like sharp swords, Like a wonderful vessel full of poison.

source_sentence: 應當棄捨如糞穢。　　貪著愛戀失正心，
translation: You should discard it like filthy dung and abandon it.

source_sentence: 是因諸有相續生，　　增長欲垢不曾斷，
translation: It is the cause of all existences that continue to arise, Increasing the defilement of desire without ever stopping it.

source_sentence: 六塵境界炎熾盛，　　猶如乾草猛火燒，
translation: The realm of the six dust motes is blazing hot, Like dry grass burned by a fierce fire.

source_sentence: 速起捨離早出家。　　智人觀察諸慾境，
translation: The wise one observes the objects of sensual desire and immediately leaves them.

source_sentence: 可畏猶如猛火坑，　　亦如魁膾屠刀机，
translation: It's as dangerous as a fierce fire pit, or like a butcher's butchering sword.

source_sentence: 亦如深泥忽溺人，　　利刃蜜塗將舌舐，
translation: It's like a person suddenly submerged in deep mud with a sharp sword of honey on their tongue and lick it.

source_sentence: 如觸蛇頭及攪屏。　　聖人觀慾亦復然，
translation: It is like touching the head of a snake, or stirring its interior.

source_sentence: 如箭如槊如劍戟，　　如毒射肉難可食。
translation: It's like an arrow, a spear, or a sword and halberd, like poisonous shooting meat that's difficult to eat.

source_sentence: 一切怨讐慾為首，　　五慾功德如水月，
translation: Desire is the foremost of all enemies; The virtues of the five desires are like the moon in water.

source_sentence: 如影亦如山谷響，　　亦如戲場眾幻師，
translation: Like a reflection, like the echoes of a mountain valley, They are also like playgrounds for magicians.

source_sentence: 猶如夢裏見喜事。　　智人見欲亦復然，
translation: It is just as when one sees a delightful object in a dream, the wise see desire.

source_sentence: 境界諸塵悉空誑，　　怖畏不能得自在，
translation: The objects of the objective world are all empty and scattered, Fearful and unable to attain freedom.

source_sentence: 譬如陽炎無有實，　　亦如水上聚浮漚，
translation: It’s like a mirage that has no substance, Like floating on the surface of water.

source_sentence: 此事皆從分別生，　　智人應觀如是等。
translation: These things all arise from discrimination, and wise people should observe such things.

source_sentence: 凡人處世年少時，　　端正可喜著諸慾，
translation: Ordinary people in the world, when they're young, are handsome and delighted with desires.

source_sentence: 及至年老頭鬚白，　　為眾棄薄如枯河。
translation: When he reaches old age, his hair and beard are white, and he abandons them for the sake of the crowd like a dried-up river.

source_sentence: 富貴饒財多放逸，　　如是之人多樂慾，
translation: Wealthy and wealthy, rich in goods and abundant in possessions, they are often lazy. Such people have many pleasures and desires,

source_sentence: 於後失財貧窮苦，　　以不自在捨於慾。
translation: In the future, they'll lose their possessions and be poor and miserable because they won't abandon their desires freely.

source_sentence: 如樹多饒華果故，　　眾人競來慾採摘，
translation: It's like a tree with plenty of flowers and fruits, With crowds rushing to gather and pluck.

source_sentence: 人喜布施亦復然，　　為他歸投無厭足，
translation: So it is with those who delight in generosity. They do so for the sake of others, without wearying their feet.

source_sentence: 其人財盡年老至，　　從他乞求不喜見，
translation: When that man’s wealth had run out and his old age was approaching, he begged others to give him alms without wishing to see him.

source_sentence: 色美財多氣力充，　　人喜愛見聚集樂，
translation: Their forms are beautiful, their wealth abundant, and full of vitality. People like to see them gather in joy.

source_sentence: 財盡行乞人不喜，　　年過膢脊手執杖，
translation: The beggar who walks with all his possessions and doesn't like it, carries a staff in his hand when he's over the top of his back.

source_sentence: 如雹折樹無人愛。　　如是可畏衰老法，
translation: Like a hailstorm that breaks down a tree and no one loves it, such is the fearsome state of old age.

source_sentence: 汝當速出求正覺，　　自證已後為人說。
translation: You should quickly leave and seek true awakening, explain it to others after you realize it for yourself.

source_sentence: 老病瘦損諸人輩，　　如摩樓迦繞大樹，
translation: Old age, illness, and thinness harmed the masses of people, Like Māra surrounding a large tree.

source_sentence: 衰老身力無精進，　　乾枯猶如朽爛木。
translation: Their aging, physical strength, and lack of energy dry up like rotten wood.

source_sentence: 老奪好色生惡色，　　怡悅顏面皮膚皺，
translation: Old age takes away good form and gives rise to bad form, With a happy countenance and wrinkled skin.

source_sentence: 老壞華色為悴色，　　欲樂奪樂令無樂，
translation: The color of old and broken flowers is the color of emaciation; Desire takes pleasure and makes happiness nonexistent.

source_sentence: 老奪威勢到命終，　　眾病至如鹿投穽，
translation: At the end of life, old age takes away power, and all illnesses are like a deer throwing themselves into a pond.

source_sentence: 汝見世間百病已，　　速說解脫方便處。
translation: Seeing the world with a hundred illnesses, you'll quickly explain the method of liberation.

source_sentence: 猶如冬天風雪雨，　　摧折樹木軟枝柯，
translation: It's like a winter storm of wind, snow, and rain that breaks down trees and weak twigs.

source_sentence: 世間老病多種至，　　諸根損瘦亦復然。
translation: The world is afflicted with many kinds of old age and illness, and so are the faculties damaged and thinned.

source_sentence: 老至令人盡倉庫，　　世間欺苦莫過老。
translation: When old age causes the storehouse to run out, there's nothing more deceiving and suffering in the world than old age.

source_sentence: 死命鬼奪人氣去，　　如日沒山不復現，
translation: Death-and-living spirits snatch the vital energy away, Like the sun disappearing into the mountains and not appearing again.

source_sentence: 死命令人恩愛離，　　使人憎嫉不喜會，
translation: Death orders people to part with kindness and love, causing others to hate and resent it and not like it.

source_sentence: 欲共恩愛之人合，　　忽失如葉墮大水。
translation: Wishing to associate with someone who loves them, they suddenly lose it like a leaf falling into a great river.

source_sentence: 死至令人不自由，　　命去如水漂一草，
translation: When death arrives, they won't be free, and their lives are like floating a blade of grass in water.

source_sentence: 人到彼世無有伴，　　隨其業緣而受有。
translation: When a person arrives in that world, there's no companion, and they experience existence according to the conditions of their actions.

source_sentence: 死命鬼飲無量眾，　　猶如摩竭吞海舟，
